basic.description: This course introduces the different paradigms of wireless and mobile networking.  It will also familiarize students with the state-of-the-art technologies, as well as with recent efforts in research and standardization.  Students taking this course will develop a strong grasp of the different architectures involved in current and future wireless networks, have a functional understanding of the different paradigms, design and analyze the behavior of wireless and mobile networks protocols using one or more network simulation tools.  PREREQUISITE: CISC-435 or equivalent.
basic.subject: CISC
basic.title: Paradigms of Wireless and Mobile Networking
